attributes.action: Consider the legality, under current privacy and human rights legislation of the compulsary entry of private homes by government inspectors for the purposes of calculating council tax.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
There is no relationship between the quality, content or location of private homes and the amount of contribution to local taxes. The intention to levy charges on this basis is penal and therefore illegal under current legislation. In addition, it has been necessary, until now, to apply for a court order or legal warrant to obtain forced entry to private premises.
The government's intention to give inspectors such rights is a total infringement of our human rights to enjoy the privacy and freedom of our own property.
